intro: Micropyxis elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed pyxie, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
